Title.evidence: We conducted the first randomized trial of perioperative normoxia

Trial_Design.evidence: We conducted the first randomized trial

Intervention.evidence: perioperative normoxia (goal PaO 2 60–100 mmHg during cardiopulmonary bypass and for the first 24 hours) versus hyperoxia (goal PaO 2 200–300 mmHg during cardiopulmonary bypass)

Objective.evidence: to examine feasibility, systemic oxidative stress response, and safety

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was a serum measure of oxidative stress: thiobarbituric acid reactive substances (TBARS)

Number_Randomised.evidence: Twenty-nine neonates (median age 5 days) were enrolled

Result_Outcome.evidence: Mean post-operative TBARS expressed as fold-change from baseline was lower in the normoxia arm at 2 hours (1.21±0.26 vs 1.93±0.63), 6 hours (1.09±0.25 vs 1.77±0.7), and 24 hours (0.96±0.16 vs 1.41±0.29); all p<0.01

Harms.evidence: Safety outcomes including in-hospital mortality and morbidities were similar between arms
